Context:
Program Name: Commercial Dance
Code: P106
Credential: Ontario College Certificate
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 1 year (3 semesters)
Starting Months: September
Domestic Tuition: $8,254.00*
International Tuition: $28,109.00 **
Centre: Arts, Design & Information Technology
School: Media & Performing Arts
Location: Casa Loma Campus
Program Description: A 12-month certificate program providing performance skills and marketability for a career in commercial dance. Graduates can dance, sing, and act, making them suitable for music videos, musical theatre, cruise ship performances, etc.
Dance training includes jazz, hip hop, and ballet with acting, vocals, and chorus repertoire. Career management and personal marketing skills are also taught.
Entrance Requirement: Intermediate jazz dance level with additional dance forms as an asset. Prospective students must pass a jazz audition and interview. (Source: "Dance Auditions" webpage)

* Domestic tuition fee for the 2023-2024 academic year
** International tuition fee for the 2023-2024 academic year
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Commercial Dance Program P106 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
Graduates of this college have found work in various industries including the commercial dance industry, project-based dance industry, traditional festivals, dance training studio industry, dance fitness and workshop industry, sports and dance teams industry, film and television industry, and further education in universities and professional development fields.

Required courses to graduate include completing all required credits and appearing in the semester 3 Showcase. Courses offered in Semester 1 are Jazz Dance I, Hip Hop I, Chorus Repertoire I, Acting for Dance I, Vocal for Dance I, Ballet I, and Communicating Across Contexts. Courses offered in Semester 2 include Jazz Dance II, Hip Hop II, Chorus Repertoire II, Acting for Dance II, Vocal for Dance II, Ballet II, Business Skills for Dancers, and Music Theory.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Commercial Dance Program P106 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
Program Offered: The college offers various dance courses with codes DANC 1071 to DANC 1085, including Performance Preparation (Field Education), Acting for Dance III, Vocal for Dance III, Chorus Repertoire III, Ballet III, Hip Hop III, Jazz Dance III.

Semester Information: Showcase rehearsal hours will be scheduled in semesters 2 and 3. These hours are categorized as in-class mandatory homework hours. They will be most intense during semester 3 and leading up to the Showcase performance.

Learning Outcomes: Graduates will be able to perform jazz and hip hop dance technique to professional standard, perform chorus repertoire technique, sing at a professional standard, create and perform artistically expressive dramatic characterizations in a dance context, present themselves professionally, develop self-knowledge and reflective practice, and exercise critical thinking skills.

Tuition & Fees: The total tuition, materials, student service, and ancillary fees for the three semesters of programs starting in Fall 2022 for domestic students is $8,254. For international students, it is $28,109. There will be a $65 audition fee payable in cash or cheque only when arriving on the day of the audition for P101, P105, or P106.

No email addresses or names were provided in the text.

Context:
* Applicants can visit the "International Fees and Related Costs" page for information on international student fees.
* Financial assistance is available for this program, and it's approved for OSAP funding for eligible applicants.
* Auditions for P101, P105, or P106 can be requested through video submissions, and more information can be found on the "Auditions" page at Ballet Jörgen or by emailing auditions@balletjorgen.ca.
* Applicants need a minimum of five years training in jazz dance, and additional dance form training is an asset.
* Mature students (19 years of age or older and no OSSD) may take the Admissions Assessment for English or consider upgrading to achieve the required English credits.
* College or university credits may qualify applicants for course exemptions. International students should refer to the "International Admissions" page for country-specific admission requirements.
* Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges, while international students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System.
* For more information about the School of Media and Performing Arts, contact Kia Kotsanis at dance@georgebrown.ca or education@balletjorgen.ca or call the Contact Centre at 416-415-2000.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Commercial Dance Program P106 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context: George Brown College offers a program in partnership with Ballet Jörgen, called "Dance Performance," which is offered through the School of Media and Performing Arts. The classes for this program take place at Casa Loma Campus, located at 160 Kendal Ave., Toronto, Ontario, Canada. International students can contact recruitment representatives specializing by country of origin by booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry through the International Contact Us page. The college provides campus tours on a regular basis and offers Domestic and International applicants to book campus tours or info sessions. Potential applicants can also sign up to receive tailored resources to make their application process easier. Esie Mensah, who graduated with an Ontario College Certificate from the college, shares her experiences of various opportunities to explore new avenues and grow as an artist. Contact details for the college include a phone number (416-415-2000) and long distance number (1-800-265-2002), with TTY number 1-877-515-5559, and an email sign-up form on their website. Additionally, virtual tours are available for those who cannot attend campus tours in person. Programs related to Dance Performance include "Dance Performance (P105)" and "Dance Performance Preparation (P101)." Other programs offered at the college include "Acting for Media (P107)."
